unnormalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices
normalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices

unnormalised: Like many folks living in bustling Mumbai, I often found myself overwhelmed. The constant honking, the demanding deadlines at work, even the simple task of grocery shopping at Crawford Market felt like a Herculean feat. I needed to find my center, my shanti. That's when I decided to delve deeper into yoga.

unnormalised: My initial exposure to yoga was rather limited. A few sun salutations (Surya Namaskar) during school PT classes and the occasional “Yoga for Beginners” YouTube video. But it wasn’t until I stumbled upon a local Iyengar yoga studio in Bandra that things truly clicked.
normalised: My initial exposure to yoga was rather limited. A few sun salutations (Surya Namaskar) during school P T classes and the occasional “Yoga for Beginners” YouTube video. But it wasn’t until I stumbled upon a local Iyengar yoga studio in Bandra that things truly clicked.

unnormalised: The meticulous precision and focus on alignment that Iyengar yoga demands initially felt a bit challenging. Dr. Patel, the instructor, was incredibly patient, guiding us through each asana with detailed instructions and adjustments. He emphasized that yoga wasn’t about achieving perfect poses, but about understanding your body and its limitations.

unnormalised: Now, several months in, I've incorporated various practices into my daily routine. A simple 15-minute session of Pranayama (breathing exercises) in the morning does wonders to calm my mind before the workday begins. In the evenings, I try to squeeze in a longer Hatha yoga session, focusing on holding poses for extended periods. I’ve even started exploring restorative yoga, which is a game-changer after a particularly stressful day. Imagine lying in Savasana (corpse pose), completely supported by bolsters and blankets, feeling all the tension melt away!

unnormalised: The physical benefits are undeniable. My flexibility has improved significantly, and my back pain, a constant companion from sitting at a desk all day in our 600 sq ft apartment, has noticeably diminished. But the mental and emotional benefits are even more profound. Yoga has taught me to be more present, to listen to my body, and to cultivate a sense of inner peace. It's not a quick fix, but a continuous journey of self-discovery. From Rs. 5000 for the monthly class, it has definitely been worth it. And maybe, just maybe, one day I’ll be flexible enough to touch my toes without bending my knees! It’s a long road from CST station to reaching perfect alignment, but I’m enjoying the ride.
